meanings.definition: To empty or evacuate (a container or space)
meanings.sent1: She was voiding the trash into the dumpster.
meanings.sent2: The plumber was voiding the clogged drain with a powerful tool.
meanings.sent3: The magician waved his wand, voiding the hat of all its contents.
meanings.sent4: The storm was voiding the streets of all signs of life.
meanings.sent5: The vacuum cleaner was voiding the room of dust and dirt.

meanings.sent1: The judge voided the contract due to a legal technicality.
meanings.sent2: The student voided his answer and wrote a new one in the exam.
meanings.sent3: The superhero had the power to void any evil plans with a single word.
meanings.sent4: The hacker was able to void the security system and gain access to the database.
meanings.sent5: The decision to void the match result caused controversy among the players.

meanings.definition: The act of urinating or defecating
meanings.sent1: After a long car ride, he finally found a restroom for voiding.
meanings.sent2: The doctor asked about the frequency of voiding during the day.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the awkwardness of public voiding situations.
meanings.sent4: The marathon runner had to time his voiding breaks strategically during the race.
meanings.sent5: The sound of voiding echoed through the quiet forest.
